resources.string: Use Mi Band to set, track, and follow your health and fitness data day and night.
You need to gain %1$s to reach your goal
You still need to pair your band with this device.
Band must be paired with your device using Bluetooth when alarm sounds.
"Band will stop vibrating automatically when it detects you've gotten out of bed. Tap the band's sensor anytime to stop alarm manually. "
"Allow Camera usage if you restricted it. If you didn't, restart the phone."
After the scale stabilizes, weigh yourself holding the infant
"Scale will calculate the infant's weight automatically"
Weigh yourself while holding the infant

"Several factors are involved in determining if a child's weight is healthy. Mi Scale compares a large pool of weight data for healthy children of the same age and gender to determine a mean weight.
A standard deviation refers to the average distance away from this group's mean weight. Weights within 1-2 standard deviations away from the group's mean weight are deemed normal. Weights below or above this range are determined to be underweight or obese, respectively.
The method above can only be used to determine if the weight of a child is normal relative to the group. Please consult a physician to confirm if a child is underweight or obese."
Weigh your infant using Mi Scale
"People's Republic of China Children Under 7 Growth Standards"
No significant change in weight was detected. Are you holding the infant?
Before you weigh in, make sure scale is on a stable, dry, and flat surface.
Sync fitness data from Mi Band with Google Fit
Pair Mi Band Pulse to monitor your heart rate
"Sync steps and sleep info with QQ Health, the app needs network connection to do that."
Sign in to QQ and check your progress in QQ Health Center.
Fitness data will be synced with Google Fit
Sync your health info with your Weibo Sport Account.
Sign in to Weibo Sport Account.
Sign in to your Weibo Account again.
"To share your fitness data with your friends, add your WeChat Account and then follow the Mi Fit Service Account."
"Add your WeChat Account, then tap Follow."
Tap Generate to create and save a QR code in Gallery.
Tap Open WeChat, then go to Scan QR code and tap Album to select the QR code you saved.

"An unexpected error occurred forcing the application to stop. Help us fix this issue by sending us error data. All you have to do is tap 'Report'."

To pair, step onto the scale
"When the band's lights start flashing, tap the metal sensor to pair."
Confirm to pair if two numbers are the same.
After you friend this person, their band will vibrate to notify them.
"You won't be able to view this person's fitness and sleep data."
Firmware is the software installed on your band that allows it to talk to your device.
"Updates can improve your band's performance and may provide support for new features."
"Make sure your band's battery has over 10% charge remaining."
Why do I need to update firmware?
"Band's battery must be above 10% before it can update."
"Couldn't update band. Some features may not work properly."
Keep %s close to your device while updating
"Infant's weight: %1$s Use Mi Scale to record your infant's weight"
Make sure the band is close to your device throughout the entire process.
"Make sure the band is charged and hasn't run out of power."
Restart Bluetooth by turning it off and then on again in system Settings.
"Make sure your band isn't already paired with another device."
Is your band too far away?
Is this band paired with another device?
Less than 10% battery left in your band
People who exercise a lot usually have a slower heart rate. Regular exercise and healthy lifestyle improve your heart condition.
Keeping the heart rate at this level helps burn more body fat and avoid damage.
Heart rate is usually faster during workout sessions
"Ideal heart rate during workout sessions: 60%-80% from maximum heart rate (220-age)"
Keep Mi Band connected to your device via Bluetooth
Connect Mi Band to view pace
Watch how your heart rate changes during the session
Fasten your band tightly to increase the accuracy of the data
"Turn on Bluetooth and connect shoes before running. Keep Bluetooth on when running."
Ideal heart rate during workout sessions for different ages
"Ideal heart rate during workout sessions: 60%-80% from maximum aerobic heart rate (220-age)"
Connect Mi Band Pulse to measure heart rate.
For example: Jack is 20, his ideal heart rate during workout sessions is 120-160 bpm (60%-80% from 200=220-20).
Band must be paired with phone for this feature to work normally.
Mi Fit must run in the background for this feature to work normally.
Make sure Mi Fit is able to stay open in the background.
Make sure Mi Fit has permission to show notifications.
Mi Fit uses this info to calculate other stats and provide other hints
"Place both feet firmly on the center of the scale."
You can pair multiple devices with a single scale
After you weigh in, the scale will sync your weight info
Choose the units that will be used to calculate your weight
"When the scale's battery needs to be replaced, the scale will display"

Place the scale on a dry surface

the icon below. After battery is replaced, the scale will restart automatically.
Make sure to stand on the center of the scale

"Experts recommend 40 minutes of exercise or about 8,000 steps a day for a healthy lifestyle."
"Experts recommend 60 minutes of exercise or about 12,000 steps a day for a healthy lifestyle."

Pause automatically when session is interrupted
"Couldn't share, check if there's enough free storage"
"You won't be able to restore items after you delete them."
Get to a place with better GPS signal to continue.
Who can try landing on their forefeet when running?
Stick to your own running habits
"We don't recommend changing your running habits. If you choose to land on your midfeet and heels, wear shoes with better cushioning to reduce the impact of landing."
When your knees require more protection, you can try landing on your forefeet more following the routine below.
Strike the ground right below you, keep your knees slightly bent, lean your body forward.
Run as if you were rotating a hot wheel with your feet.
Make smaller steps when you increase running speed.
Connect running shoes and make sure you land on your forefeet.
"Turn on Bluetooth and connect shoes before running. Keep Bluetooth on when running."
Pace is the number of steps you make per minute when running.
Runners usually increase their stride to gain speed. However, using this method can result in muscle damage. You can try to increase your pace to gain speed.
Long-distance runners usually make 180 steps per minute. We recommend using this value as your pace goal.
Connect Mi Band, make sure your pace is detected.
"Turn on Bluetooth and connect Mi Band before running. Keep Bluetooth on when running."

When running slowly, most people would naturally land on their midfeet or heels. When the running speed increases, more people would strike the ground with their forefeet. For example, most sprinters choose to land on their forefeet when running.
Landing on your midfeet or heels strongly affects your knees. Striking the ground with your forefeet requires stronger calf muscles and Achilles tendons
Turn on heart rate sensor in Settings
Use GPS together with your Mi Band
Make your running data even more accurate

Turn on GPS to increase the accuracy of your route.

We recommend to set media volume to low so that you are able to hear voice instructions when running.
Put the QRCode in the square to scan.

"Scan Huami core module's QR code to pair."
"Shake Huami sensor, then align the QR code in the frame"
"Stand with your feet shoulder width apart Wait for 5s "
"Put Huami sensor into the shoes with Li-Ning logo facing up"
Remember to recalibrate every time after removing the sensor
"Couldn't connect, shake sensor lightly to activate"

With average life span of 400 to 800 km, running shoes are considered to be a long-term investment. That’s why most runners choose top-end products to make sure their running experience is healthy and comfortable.
Scan QR code of the item you want to update
Connect shoes to get accurate running data
Scan the QR code placed on Huami core module
You need to calibrate to get accurate data. Skip calibration?
"Your shoes won't be able to sync running data with your phone."
Measure heart rate every 2 min after you fall asleep to make sleep data more accurate.
Measure heart rate periodically after you fall asleep to make sleep data more accurate (may consume battery faster).
"Wake up at the best time according to your natural sleep cycle. Band will vibrate when it detects you've entered light sleep less than 30 minutes prior to the alarm time."
Band must be paired with your device using Bluetooth when message is received.

Body mass index (BMI) is a measure of body fat based on height and weight that applies to adult men and women.
BMI is a measure of body fat based on height and weight. The physical distribution of fat varies widely among different body types.
"This scale won't be able to sync your weight data."

Wait until the LED notification light blinks before stepping on the scale.
